item.title: Note
item.description: I think I was destined to be an economist from the time I took John Livernois' class at Guelph, although I fought this particular destiny for years before I gave in. I remember John asking us questions like, “if the Premier asked for your advice…” and “if you had to advise the manager of a company on how to reduce their emissions, given this information, what would you suggest?” Simple, yes, and contrived, but they put the goal in my head.
